intro: Lefebvrea tenuis, commonly known as the slender lefebvria, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its delicate, narrow leaves and small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its natural habitat.
